cisc187.dna

Class Sequencer

  • java.lang.Object
    • cisc187.dna.Sequencer

  • public final class Sequencer
extends Object
    Main DNA Sequencer / Splicer program.

    A key element in many bioinformatics problems is the biological sequence. A biological sequence is just a list of characters chosen from some alphabet. Two of the common biological sequences are DNA (composed of the four characters A, C, G, and T) and RNA (composed of the four characters A, C, G, and U).

    This program implements some basic functionality for manipulating DNA and RNA sequence fragments.

    Not that all methods are static and this class cannot be instantiated.

    Author:
    Dave Parillo

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Main DNA Fragment manipulation program.

        This program reads a text file containing DNA or RNA sequence fragments and commands representing operations to perform on those sequences.

        Parameters:
        args - command line arguments. Exactly 2 are expected:
        1. args[0] The maxiumum number of DNA fragments this sequencer can hold
        2. args[1] The file from which to read sequencer commands

      • usage

        private static void usage()
        Show information on proper usage of the main method of this class.

      • process

        private static void process(String filename)
        Process the command file.
        Parameters:
        filename - command file name received on the comamnd line. See main for details.

      • processCommand

        private static void processCommand(String line)
        Process the next line in a DNA fragments command file.

        A valid command is a string followed by up to 4 arguments, depending on the command.

        Parameters:
        line - a line of text that may or may not contain valid commands
